Taoist Meditation & Tea Ceremony

The tea ceremony embodies the principles of harmony, respect, purity and tranquility as pathways to achieve a sense of persoanl and social oneness. This evening, we will enjoy tea and a discussion about the tea ceremony as spiritual practice...

Christine will discuss Taoism's influence on and relationship to the tea ceremony. Taoist Master Kim will speak about the Taoist concept of oneness with nature to attain original wholeness. We will also be joined this evening by Helen Grzelak, a Tea Master from China and co-founder of Lotus Leaf Tea, who speak about the tea ceremony as a meditative art and an alternative healing modality to heal the body, mind and soul. Charles Silverstein, coordinator of the Conscous Evolution program at The Graduate Institute, also joins us to offer his insight into spiritual practice as part of human development. 

The evening will consist of a one hour Taoist yoga-meditation with light stretching followed by a Yobanashi tea ceremony. A Yobanashi celebrates the long winter night and is traditionally held between January 12th and March 11th. In the winter, when the sun sets very early, a Yobanashi tea can be enjoyed with a small lighted candle to create a warm atmosphere in the cold winter months.

To begin the ceremony, each guests will receive a votive candle for meditation. Spoken haiku poetry will also be part of the event and the theme will be "winter darkness". Our tea selection will be a roasted formosa oolong tea.

Cost is a $5 donation.

 

Full moon --
stepping through the snow
the sound of the stones.

From beyond the clouds,
the voice of a bamboo flute,
approaches -- listening,
it seems the moon's reflection
is right here in our cupped hands.

 



Taoist meditation is a method for cultivating, refining, and circulating internal energy within the chakras and meridian channels in the body. Taoists believe that breathing and energy meditation fills the reservoirs of the chakras and meridian with energy, which is then distributed to all the major organ systems.
